question: The first Roll on- Roll Off (RORO) service of which section of Indian Railways was flagged off recently?
explanation:
The first Roll on Roll off (RORO) service of the South Western Railways was flagged off from Nelamangla (Karnataka) to Solapur (Maharashtra). RORO is the transportation model where trucks loaded with various commodities are loaded on open flat railway wagons.
Jitendra Realty and Infrastructure, a Solapur based firm, explored the commercial feasibility of RO-RO train services between Solapur and Bengaluru. It was approved by the Railway Board in April 2020.
